column4: How can I point the bootloader to a different grub file, and is it safe pointing from a gnome install to a kde install and vice versa? (gnome uses menu.lst and kde is using grub.cfg)
only grub uses the grub config

My appologies, you're right. What I meant was a kubuntu 9.10 install vs a ubuntu 9.04 install... Can I point the bootloader to the other ones grub file? My goal is to make my previous install the primary, with modifications, incase I decide to delete the kubuntu install.
